title: ZyXEL P-2812HNU-F1, replacing the U-Boot on the board
content:
I want flash regular(non branded) firmware on ZyXEL P-2812HNU-F1 router, which have branded version of firmware (customized for local MSO provider). To do this, I should first replace the U-Boot image on the board. The full procedure is described in Wiki. However, this procedure is for installing OpenWrt on ZyXEL P-2812HNU-FX series. In my case I just want flash the regular unbranded firmware version from the manufacturer's repository, not OpenWrt.

What's not clear: do I need another special U-Boot version, tailored to regular generic (nonbranded) ZyXEL firmware, or I can use U-Boot version created for OpenWrt?

comments.text: Did you have a look at the end of the wiki entry? This manual seems to be related: forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?pid=221104
I'm not sure this is really about Reverse Engineering; looks like embedded development to me
Have read this too. I couldn't find the argument of ATSE command. ATSE x (where x is argument of ATSE command). I've tried various, but no one is worked.
